required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of MM-121 Combination Therapy in Patients With Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1-2 Trial of MM-121 in Combination With Erlotinib in Three Groups of Patients With Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase 1-2 study of MM-121 in combination with standard therapy for non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

detailed_description.textblock:
Phase 1: Patients with Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) may be enrolled to evaluate the safety, tolerability and recommended Phase 2 dose of MM-121 in combination with standard therapy.
Phase 2: Patients with Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) may be enrolled to estimate the progression-free survival of the MM-121 + standard therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 1: To Determine the Recommended Phase 2 Dose of the MM-121 + Erlotinib Combination Based Upon Either the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) or the Maximum Feasible Dose of the Combination in Patients With NSCLC.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose to 30 days after termination, the longest 175 weeks
primary_outcome.description: To establish the safety of escalating doses of MM-121 in combination with erlotinib in order to determine the recommended phase 2 dose of the combination for the second part of the study. Dose-escalation conducted using standard 3+3 model to determine maximum tolerated dose. Reports of Dose-Limiting Toxicities (DLTs) were assessed to determine the MTD.

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 1: Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose Dependent on Reports of Dose-limiting Toxicities
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose to 30 days after termination, the longest 175 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Using a 3+3 dose escalation model, the maximum tolerated dose was determined by assessing dose-limiting toxicities in each cohort. If 3 patients were treated and passed the observation window, escalation to the next cohort was initiated. If a DLT was reported, 3-4 additional patients were enrolled and observed. If a DLT was observed in the expanded cohort, this dose was considered to be the maximum tolerated dose. The maximum tolerated dose was defined at the cohort in which two dose-limiting toxicities were observed, or as the highest target dose tested in the absence of DLTs. The determined MTD was used as the recommended Phase 2 dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 2: Progression-free Survival of the MM-121 + Erlotinib Combination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time from first dose to date of progression, with a median of 8.1 weeks
primary_outcome.description: This was a time-to-event measure using Progression-Free Survival (PFS) comparing MM-121 + erlotinib vs.erlotinib alone. Progression of disease is defined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.1), as a 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, or a measurable increase in a non-target lesion, or the appearance of new lesions". Progression free survival was defined as the number of weeks from the date of randomization to the date of death or progression. If neither death nor progression was observed during the study, PFS data was censored at the last non-progressive disease valid tumor assessment unless the patient was discontinued due to symptomatic deterioration. If this occurred, the patient was counted as having progressive disease (PD).

arm_group.description: Escalating doses of MM-121 (QOW IV) and erlotinib (daily PO)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with locally advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer.
- Patients must be >/= 18 years of age.
- Patients must have adequate Performance Status (PS) as measured by ECOG and adequate end organ function.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a recent history (within 5 years) of another malignancy.
- Patients who are pregnant or nursing.
- Patients with clinically significant heart failure.
- Patients with clinically significant eye or gastrointestinal abnormalities.

group.title: Phase 1: MM-121 + Erlotinib
group.description: Escalating doses of MM-121 and erlotinib

group.title: Phase 2: MM-121 + Erlotinib
group.description: EGFR wild-type, EGFR-TKI naive patients randomized to receive: MM-121 every other week at a dose of 20 mg/kg IV in combination with daily 100 mg erlotinib p.o.

group.title: Phase 2: Erlotinib
group.description: EGFR wild-type, EGFR-TKI naive patients randomized to receive: daily 150 mg erlotinib p.o. alone

baseline.population: Ph 1: Patients with NSCLC Ph 2:Patients whose tumors are wild-type for EGFR and who have not received prior EGFR TKI targeted therapy.

group.description: Escalating doses of MM-121 + Erlotinib in patients with NSCLC

group.description: EGFR wild-type, EGFR-TKI naive patients randomized to receive: daily 150 mg erlotinib p.o. alone

Dose-escalation conducted using standard 3+3 model to determine maximum tolerated dose. Reports of Dose-Limiting Toxicities (DLTs) were assessed to determine the MTD.

measure.title: Phase 1: To Determine the Recommended Phase 2 Dose of the MM-121 + Erlotinib Combination Based Upon Either the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) or the Maximum Feasible Dose of the Combination in Patients With NSCLC.
measure.description: To establish the safety of escalating doses of MM-121 in combination with erlotinib in order to determine the recommended phase 2 dose of the combination for the second part of the study. Dose-escalation conducted using standard 3+3 model to determine maximum tolerated dose. Reports of Dose-Limiting Toxicities (DLTs) were assessed to determine the MTD.

outcome.title: Phase 1: Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose Dependent on Reports of Dose-limiting Toxicities
outcome.description: Using a 3+3 dose escalation model, the maximum tolerated dose was determined by assessing dose-limiting toxicities in each cohort. If 3 patients were treated and passed the observation window, escalation to the next cohort was initiated. If a DLT was reported, 3-4 additional patients were enrolled and observed. If a DLT was observed in the expanded cohort, this dose was considered to be the maximum tolerated dose. The maximum tolerated dose was defined at the cohort in which two dose-limiting toxicities were observed, or as the highest target dose tested in the absence of DLTs. The determined MTD was used as the recommended Phase 2 dose.
outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose to 30 days after termination, the longest 175 weeks
outcome.population: All participants treated in the Phase 1 dose-escalation portion of the study

group.title: Phase 1: All Participants
group.description: All participants in the dose escalation portion of the Phase 1

measure.title: Phase 1: Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose Dependent on Reports of Dose-limiting Toxicities
measure.description: Using a 3+3 dose escalation model, the maximum tolerated dose was determined by assessing dose-limiting toxicities in each cohort. If 3 patients were treated and passed the observation window, escalation to the next cohort was initiated. If a DLT was reported, 3-4 additional patients were enrolled and observed. If a DLT was observed in the expanded cohort, this dose was considered to be the maximum tolerated dose. The maximum tolerated dose was defined at the cohort in which two dose-limiting toxicities were observed, or as the highest target dose tested in the absence of DLTs. The determined MTD was used as the recommended Phase 2 dose.
measure.population: All participants treated in the Phase 1 dose-escalation portion of the study

measurement_list.measurement: Maximum tolerated dose was not reached. Recommended Phase 2 Dose (MM-121 mg/kg IV Q2W + erlotinib 100 mg PO daily) was selected based on Investigator agreement on safety profile and PK parameters.

outcome.title: Phase 2: Progression-free Survival of the MM-121 + Erlotinib Combination
outcome.description: This was a time-to-event measure using Progression-Free Survival (PFS) comparing MM-121 + erlotinib vs.erlotinib alone. Progression of disease is defined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.1), as a 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, or a measurable increase in a non-target lesion, or the appearance of new lesions". Progression free survival was defined as the number of weeks from the date of randomization to the date of death or progression. If neither death nor progression was observed during the study, PFS data was censored at the last non-progressive disease valid tumor assessment unless the patient was discontinued due to symptomatic deterioration. If this occurred, the patient was counted as having progressive disease (PD).
outcome.time_frame: Time from first dose to date of progression, with a median of 8.1 weeks

group.title: Erlotinib
group.description: EGFR wild-type, EGFR-TKI naive patients randomized to receive: daily 150 mg erlotinib p.o. alone

measure.title: Phase 2: Progression-free Survival of the MM-121 + Erlotinib Combination
measure.description: This was a time-to-event measure using Progression-Free Survival (PFS) comparing MM-121 + erlotinib vs.erlotinib alone. Progression of disease is defined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.1), as a 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, or a measurable increase in a non-target lesion, or the appearance of new lesions". Progression free survival was defined as the number of weeks from the date of randomization to the date of death or progression. If neither death nor progression was observed during the study, PFS data was censored at the last non-progressive disease valid tumor assessment unless the patient was discontinued due to symptomatic deterioration. If this occurred, the patient was counted as having progressive disease (PD).

outcome.title: To Explore the Utility of an EGFR Family Receptor-ligand (Heregulin, HRG) as a Predictor of Response to MM-121 and /or Erlotinib in Formalin Fixed (FFPE) Tumor Samples
outcome.description: Tumor tissue samples were obtained from patients prior to enrollment. Samples were analyzed using RNA-ISH for the expression of the biomarker, heregulin. Progression-free survival was assessed using RECIST v 1.1 to determine whether patients whose tumors express HRG have a lower PFS than those whose tumors do not express HRG, and to assess whether the addition of MM-121 to erlotinib can increase PFS in HRG-high patients.
outcome.time_frame: Time from first dose to date of progression, with a median of 8.1 weeks
outcome.population: Patients with available tissue for heregulin testing

measure.description: Tumor tissue samples were obtained from patients prior to enrollment. Samples were analyzed using RNA-ISH for the expression of the biomarker, heregulin. Progression-free survival was assessed using RECIST v 1.1 to determine whether patients whose tumors express HRG have a lower PFS than those whose tumors do not express HRG, and to assess whether the addition of MM-121 to erlotinib can increase PFS in HRG-high patients.

measurement_list.measurement: Upper bound was not evaluable due to too few events
Upper bound was not evaluable due to too few events

reported_events.time_frame: AEs were collected from a patient's first dose until 30 days after treatment termination. SAEs were collected from time of informed consent until 30 days after termination. If related, events could be reported at any time after termination.
reported_events.desc: All related AEs ongoing at the time of treatment discontinuation were followed until resolution. Investigators were to report any AEs/SAEs assumed to be related any time, even if occurring more than 30 days after last dose. Though different for each patient, on average, patients could be followed for related AEs/SAEs for ~1 year after termination.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
